comments:
I200411240800-gtk + recent ZRH plug-in export.

Reproducable in the state I am in (not sure what happens upon workbench restart):

- start the workbench
- press Ctrl+Shift+T to open IHyperlinkDetector (new class, will be in the next
I build)
- Get a bunch of exceptions, dialog box informing me that the execution of my
command failed. 

Exceptions below. I think that the NoClassDefFoundError is the root of the
problem, even though it gets logged last.

What I don't know is why debug.ui had to be activated when opening a type - at
first glance, I don't see any reason for debug to activate.

-- snip --

Doug, looking at the trace, the culprit looks like 
IWorkbenchCommandSuupport.addHandlerSubmission(...) needs to be called in the 
UI thread. Is this a known limitation? (the API does not mention it, that I 
saw).

It is not safe to call any Platform UI code from a non-UI thread unless the API 
specifically says so.  The vast majority can't be run on a non-UI thread.  So, 
the code that can is more of an exception than a rule. 
 
Unfortunately, there is no place where this fact is written down.  I have filed 
Bug 79777 to cover this.

Fixed in DebugUIPlugin. Moved the initialization code into an async exec to be 
run in the UI thread.
